cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSE of Ocean City, Maryland
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-to-north-northeast just off the Delmarva coast, then expected to come ashore near southern New Jersey and continue inland toward the Northeast U.S.

weather_observation.watch_coast: n/a — no watches posted south of Cape May, NJ
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic shoreline from Cape Hatteras northward through Delaware, New Jersey, Long Island and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Brief period of strong northerly winds 25–35 mph with gusts near 45 mph possible this morning as the storm passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rise of 1–2 ft possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and ocean-side inlets; significant surge above 3 ft is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher toward the Eastern Shore, could cause brief ponding and minor flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat mainly east of the Chesapeake Bay; operations could also be slowed by low ceilings and visibility in heavy showers.
